summary: A tuple-definition creates a new tuple-type in the enclosing package.
details: A tuple is an immutable user-defined datatype.
Regarding the tuple-type T created by a definition:
A tuple-type is form of class-type.
T is both public and final.
T is a subtype of interface Record.
T is a subtype of class AbstractRecord.
T inherits all the elements that are declared in its supertypes.
Because T is a tuple-type, there must exist an explicit declaration elementi in T for every element.
As a consequence, a tuple imposes a user-defined total-ordering on its elements.
The order of the elements in a tuple is the same as they appear in the list of elements.
On the other hand, the order of the elements in a struct is lexicographical.
T declares the following methods and constructors:
Let C denote the sole constructor declared by T:
C creates an immutable instance of T.
C takes one formal-parameter P for each element E.
P's static-type is the static-type of the element E.
C will assign the value of P to element E in the new instance.
The order of C's formal-parameters is the same as the elements in the list of elements.
This is a consequence of the aforedescribed user-defined total-ordering of the elements.
For each element E in an instance I of T:
T contains a setter method S for element E.
The name of S is the name of E.
S takes a single formal-parameter P.
The static-type of P is the static-type of E.
S obtains a copy M of I.
S assigns the value of P to element E in instance M.
The return-type of S is T.
S returns M.
T contains a getter method G for element E.
The name of G is the name of E.
G does not take any formal-parameters.
The return-type of G is the static-type of element E.
G returns the value stored in element E in instance I.
T provides bridge methods for method set(int, Object).
For X, where X is T or a supertype thereof, such that X is also a subtype of Record:
set(int, Object) : X is a bridge method in T.
set(int, Object) : Record is invoked by the bridge method.
Although the bridge method must downcast the return-value, the cast always succeeds.
T provides a special static method instance() : T.
The method returns an instance of T in which each element is set to is default value.
The method always returns the same object.
T inherits the following method declarations from its supertypes.
copy ()
compareTo (autumn.lang.Record)
compareTo (java.lang.Object)
equals (java.lang.Object)
get (int)
hashCode ()
isEmpty ()
isStruct ()
isTuple ()
iterator ()
keys ()
set (int, java.lang.Object)
size ()
toString ()
types ()
values ()
getClass ()
notify ()
notifyAll ()
wait ()
wait (long, int)
wait (long)
static-checks: Each annotation in an annotation-list must be uniquely typed.
Each annotation in an annotation-list must be uniquely typed.
No two types can share the same descriptor.
The name of each element must be unique within the enclosing definition.
The type specified by element.type must exist.
The type specified by element.type must be accessible.
The type of each element must be a variable-type.
The type of an element must be the same in all the declarations of the element.
A tuple must explicitly declare all of its elements, including inherited elements.
